bestBHT.bht: The harvest described in this passage is the gathering of God's saints, reaped from the earth through the preaching of the everlasting gospel. This harvest serves as a response to the impending wrath upon those who worship the image or receive the mark of the beast. The ministers of the Gospel, acting as reapers, use the sickle, symbolizing the Gospel itself, to accomplish this task according to Christ's will. Through this process, the righteous are gathered to Christ, resulting in a glorious harvest for the redeemed church.

Henry Alford: The harvest is the ingathering of the saints, God's harvest, reaped from the earth."
This harvest answers to the great preaching of the everlasting gospel.
The following vintage fulfills the denunciations of wrath on those who worship the image or receive the mark of the beast.
Albert Barnes: Thrust in his sickle on the earth - To cut down the harvest - that is, to gather his people to himself.
And the earth was reaped - So far as the righteous were concerned.
The end had come; the church was redeemed; the work contemplated was accomplished; and the results of the work of the Saviour were like a glorious harvest.
Archibald T. Robertson: No violence by the use of εβαλεν as is seen in Matthew 10:34 (βαλειν ειρηνην, to bring peace).
Both prophetic aorists again. Christ puts in the sickle as he wills with his own agents.
Cast (εβαλεν). Second aorist active indicative of βαλλω.
John Gill: The reapers are the ministers of the Gospel; such were the apostles of Christ, John 4:36 and the sickle is the Gospel, by which not only men are cut to the heart, and cut down, and removed from their old bottom, and principles and practices, but are gathered to Christ, and into his churches.
John Wesley: Crying - By the command of God.
Thrust in thy sickle, for the harvest is ripe - This implies an high degree of holiness in those good men, and an earnest desire to be with God.

bhtAttempts.bht: The harvest in Revelation 14:16 represents the gathering of the saints, the followers of God who have been reaped from the earth by the preaching of the everlasting gospel. This harvest is a response to the wrath that is to come upon those who worship the image or receive the mark of the beast. The use of the word thrust in (εβαλεν) highlights that this action is not done violently, but rather in accordance with Christ's will. The reapers, who are the ministers of the Gospel, carry out this task by using the sickle, which symbolizes the Gospel itself. Through this process, the righteous are gathered to Christ like a glorious harvest, as the church is redeemed and the work of the Savior is accomplished.

The harvest in Revelation 14:16 represents the ingathering of the saints, reaped from the earth through the preaching of the everlasting gospel. This harvest is a response to the denunciations of wrath on those who worship the image or receive the mark of the beast. The reapers, the ministers of the Gospel, use the sickle, symbolizing the Gospel, to gather the righteous to Christ. This process fulfills the work of the Savior and results in a glorious harvest for the redeemed church.

The harvest in this passage symbolizes the gathering of God's saints, reaped from the earth by the preaching of the everlasting gospel. It serves as a response to the impending wrath upon those who worship the image or receive the mark of the beast. The ministers of the Gospel, acting as reapers, use the sickle, representing the Gospel itself, to carry out this task according to Christ's will. Through this process, the righteous are gathered to Christ, resulting in a glorious harvest for the redeemed church.

The harvest in Revelation 14:16 signifies the gathering of the saints, reaped from the earth through the preaching of the everlasting gospel. It is a response to the wrath coming upon those who worship the image or bear the mark of the beast. The reapers, the ministers of the Gospel, employ the sickle as they gather the righteous to Christ. This process fulfills the work of the Savior and brings about a glorious harvest for the redeemed church.

The harvest described in this passage is the gathering of God's saints, reaped from the earth through the preaching of the everlasting gospel. This harvest serves as a response to the impending wrath upon those who worship the image or receive the mark of the beast. The ministers of the Gospel, acting as reapers, use the sickle, symbolizing the Gospel itself, to accomplish this task according to Christ's will. Through this process, the righteous are gathered to Christ, resulting in a glorious harvest for the redeemed church.
